summary:
Germany is made up of 16 states, including 3 city-states (Berlin, Hamburg, and Bremen). The other 13 are called "area states." In 1949, West Germany was formed with 11 states, and more joined later. After the reunification of Germany in 1990, 5 new states were added from East Germany.

Germany has a federal system, where some powers are given to the national government, and others to the states. States have control over education and culture. They can also make international agreements in certain areas with the federal government's approval.
title: States of Germany
